title: Riot Attention on non-Riot thread is Pathetic
body: Let's not forget they promised with these new boards would come much more Riot thread interaction. Just scroll down and see for yourself...

You know.  The same logic could be used if you accidentally shoot yourself in the hand with a nail gun; "Hey, at least it's only one hand with a nail in it, Jesus had two."  

The thing is; the logic "it could be worse" is a horrible way to look at life.  It can always be worse but conversely it can always be better.  This fact makes this type of logic equivalent to saying; "look here we are."  It also comes with it though an certain amount of implied fear of change or pessimism.  "here we are but don't move because if you do it'll get worse."  

It does happen that trying to change something for the better has made it worse but it is a rare occurrence.  Usually if you work towards something better you achieve something better.  In this case the OP is putting time in to try and build a better level of communication with the reds.  I was adding a bit of time to work towards that end too because I think it's a good goal.  You actually put your time in opposition to that and told riot you are happy with this current level of interaction.  You even went so far as to say you are more afraid any change will be bad so pls do Not change at all.  

Now there is logic in comparing two separate regions.  It is relate-able information and has value.  I would ask the question; Are those the only two? and if not how is the dev interaction on the other ones?

Bug report/balance are doing fine as far as I know. The whole story board is getting pretty much nothing from Riot despite them announcing retconning the very premise of the lore. Shouldn't such a change be heavily discussed by Riot too? The community sure did. 

Heck, right now they're not only retconning the IoW but also whatever else they don't like, like Xerath (and Trundle, he too is part of this new lore). But all posts from narrative are just moving on and plainly accepting the retconning of not only the premise of the lore but also the characters. They're some neat details about Azir and such.

However, for me from EUW, there's now a chance of a relevant Rioter reading my post, so that's nice.
